article.headline: Montana 70, Montana State 61
article.story: MISSOULA, Mont. (AP) -- Kevin Criswell scored 18 points Saturday and passed Montana assistant coach Wayne Tinkle in career scoring in a 70-61 victory over Montana State. Criswell, already Montana's career leader in 3-pointers made, hit a 3-pointer and had a key steal during a 12-0 run that put the Grizzlies in control. The win gave Montana (17-5, 7-3 Big Sky) a season sweep of Montana State (13-11, 6-4) for the first time in six years, and sole possession of second place in the league standings. Montana trailed 46-45 with 10:23 remaining before going on its run. It started with a free throw by Andrew Strait and included 3-pointers by Criswell and Mike Chavez and a tip-in by Matt Martin after a steal and missed layup by Criswell. Montana continued with another free throw by Strait and a turnaround jumper by Chavez to take a 57-46 lead with 6:45 remaining. A basket by Criswell gave the Grizzlies a 62-49 lead with 5:30 remaining and Montana State could get no closer than the final margin. Criswell now has 1,509 points in his career, moving into fourth place ahead of Tinkle, who scored 1,500 points. Criswell, who walked on to the UM team as a freshman, said: "I respect coach Tinks so much. It's nice to pass him. I never once thought it would be like this." Jordan Hasquet added 15 points and six rebounds for the Grizzlies, who trailed 37-33 after a basket by Marvin Moss with 15:07 remaining. Two free throws by Matt Dlouhy, followed with a steal by Martin and a dunk by Hasquet tied the score at 37 with 14:37 remaining. A layup by Derrick Edmonds put MSU up 39-37, but Hasquet tied the score on a basket with 13:47 to play. Hasquet's grandfather, Robert, who played basketball for the Grizzlies in the late 1940s and early 1950s, was introduced before the game as part of the school's celebration of 100 years of Grizzly basketball. "It was pretty easy to get inspired for this game," Hasquet said. "There were tons of relatives in town for his 80th birthday. I was playing for my gramps tonight." A layup by Hasquet with 11:42 remaining gave Montana a 45-41 lead, before a three-point play by Edmonds and a jumper by Al Beye put MSU up 46-45. The 3-pointer by Criswell sparked the Griz rally. "What stands out is around that nine-minute mark, it started with Criswell's 3," said MSU coach Mick Durham. "It's my fault. I was trying to get to the eight minute timeout and the lead ballooned to eight." The game was tight for the first 30 minutes. A 3-pointer by Carson Durr with 56 seconds left in the half put MSU up 32-29 at halftime. "I thought in the first four minutes of the second half they came out flat, the crowd wasn't into it and we had a chance to get some breathing room and didn't do it," Durham said. The same thing happened in January's Cat-Griz matchup. Montana State built a 47-40 lead before Montana rallied to take a 59-51 lead and went on to win 80-64. Casey Durham had 11 points and six rebounds for the Bobcats. Edmonds also finished with 11 points. Moss and Beye each had nine points and seven rebounds. Strait added 11 points and seven rebounds for Montana.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
